paragraphs.zh-tw: Hi there. I'm going to be talking a little bit about music, machines and life. Or, more specifically, what we learned from the creation of a very large and complicated machine for a music video.
paragraphs.en: 大家好 等一下我要跟各位聊聊有關 音樂、機械、和生活 或者更具體地說 我們能從一個為了拍MV而做的龐大、複雜的機器中 學到些什麼

paragraphs.zh-tw: Some of you may recognize this image. This is the opening frame of the video that we created.
paragraphs.en: 可能有些人看過這照片中的場景 這是我們設計的音樂錄影帶的開頭

paragraphs.zh-tw: We'll be showing the video at the end, but before we do, I want to talk a little bit about what it is that they wanted. Now, when we first started talking to OK Go -- the name of the song is "This Too Shall Pass" -- we were really excited because they expressed interest in building a machine that they could dance with.
paragraphs.en: 演講最後我們會播放這卷音樂錄影帶 在此之前，我想告訴各位 他們對這影片的訴求 當我們開始和OK Go這樂團討論 他們的作品"一切終將過去"時 我們覺得非常興奮，因為 他們想要一個能與人共舞的機械裝置

paragraphs.zh-tw: And we were very excited about this because, of course, they have a history of dancing with machines. They're responsible for this video, "Here It Goes Again." 50-million-plus views on YouTube.
paragraphs.en: 另一個讓我們感到興奮的 那是因為 他們過去有類似的豐富經驗 他們自製的音樂錄影帶"我們又來了!" 在Youtube上超過5千萬的瀏覽次數

paragraphs.zh-tw: Four guys dancing on treadmills, no cuts, just a static camera. A fantastically viral and wonderful video.
paragraphs.en: 4個大男人在跑步機上跳舞 沒有剪接，只用一台固定的攝影機拍攝 這影片不但在網路上快速傳播而且非常完美

paragraphs.zh-tw: So we were really excited about working with them. And we sort of started talking about what it is that they wanted.
paragraphs.en: 所以我們真的很高興有機會跟他們合作 我們一開始在初步討論時

paragraphs.zh-tw: And they explained that they wanted kind of a Rube Goldberg machine. Now, for those of you who don't know, a Rube Goldberg machine is a complicated contraption, an incredibly over-engineered piece of machinery that accomplishes a relatively simple task.
paragraphs.en: 他們就指出 他們想要一個"魯布-戈德堡機械裝置" 現場可能有人不知道這是什麼 魯布-戈德堡機械裝置 它的構造非常複雜 並且用極端缺乏效率的運作過程 去完成一件極簡單的事情

paragraphs.zh-tw: So we were excited by this idea, and we started talking about exactly what it would look like. And we came up with some parameters, because, you know, building a Rube Goldberg machine has limitations, but it also is pretty wide open.
paragraphs.en: 我們對這個構想非常感興趣 於是我們開始著手 並與他們討論詳細內容 我們想出一些裝置在設計上的主要條件 你們要瞭解，搭建魯布-戈德堡機械裝置 有些限制 但它同時也是很開放的

paragraphs.zh-tw: And we wanted to make sure that we did something that would work for a music video. So we came up with a list of requirements, the "10 commandments," and they were, in order of ascending difficulty: The first is "No magic." Everything that happened on screen had to be very easily understood by a typical viewer.
paragraphs.en: 而我們希望我們所作的成果 能夠完整呈現在音樂錄影帶裡面 所以我們將這些條件條列化 稱為"10誡" 依照執行難度依序告訴各位 第一，不用複雜取巧的戲法 影片內容要親民 任何觀眾都要能看的懂

paragraphs.zh-tw: The rule of thumb was that, if my mother couldn't understand it, then we couldn't use it in the video. They wanted band integration, that is, the machine acting upon the band members, specifically not the other way around.
paragraphs.en: 簡單來說，若有我老媽感到困惑的部份 這部份就不能出現在影片中 第二，要融入樂團成員 機器的運作過程能讓樂團成員參與其中 不能只有機器在表演

paragraphs.zh-tw: They wanted the machine action to follow the song feeling. So as the song picks up emotion, so should the machine get grander in its process.
paragraphs.en: 第三，機器的運作要配合音樂的節奏與情緒 如果音樂來到情緒表現比較強的部份 那麼機器呈現的運作過程 就必須比較華麗、壯觀

paragraphs.zh-tw: They wanted us to make use of the space. So we have this 10,000-square-foot warehouse we were using, divided between two floors.
paragraphs.en: 第四，要利用廣大的空間 所以我們找了一個上下二層 合計1萬平方英呎的大倉庫

paragraphs.zh-tw: It included an exterior loading dock. We used all of that, including a giant hole in the floor that we actually descended the camera and cameraman through.
paragraphs.en: 倉庫有一個裝卸貨物的月台 我們利用倉庫裡的所有東西，包括地板上的大坑洞 讓我們的攝影機和工作人員能順利拍攝

paragraphs.zh-tw: They wanted it messy, and we were happy to oblige. The machine itself would start the music.
paragraphs.en: 第五，要看起來很凌亂，這我們很願意效勞 第六，裝置可以啟動音樂

paragraphs.zh-tw: So the machine would get started, it would travel some distance, reacting along the way, hit play on an iPod or a tape deck or something that would start playback. And the machine would maintain synchronization throughout.
paragraphs.en: 當裝置啟動時 它要能跑來跑去 並在這過程中不斷啟動各種開關 然後啟動iPod或錄音帶的播放 或是一些錄音裝置 裝置要能與音樂同步化

paragraphs.zh-tw: And speaking of synchronization, they wanted it to sync to the rhythm and to hit specific beats along the way. Okay.
paragraphs.en: 他們要求的同步化 不但裝置運作要跟著音樂的節拍走 還要能配合特定的節拍點 ........好吧

paragraphs.zh-tw: They wanted it to end precisely on time. Okay, so now the start to finish timing has to be perfect.
paragraphs.en: 要能在精準的時間內結束 好吧，所以裝置的啟動到結束要非常精準

paragraphs.zh-tw: And they wanted the music to drop out at a certain point in the video and actual live audio from the machine to play part of the song. And as if that wasn't enough, all of these incredibly complicating things, right, they wanted it in one shot.
paragraphs.en: 然後在影片中的特定時刻 必須要把音樂停止播放 沒有音樂的這個時段 要用機器的運作來發出聲音 這些還不夠 拍攝這支影片 還要一鏡到底不剪接

paragraphs.zh-tw: Okay. So, just some statistics about what we went through in the process.
paragraphs.en: 好吧 那麼，針對這個裝置 我們做了一些統計

paragraphs.zh-tw: The machine itself has 89 distinct interactions. It took us 85 takes to get it on film to our satisfaction.
paragraphs.en: 它擁有 89個不同的互動裝置 我們前前後後 拍了85次 確保有達到我們想要的成果

paragraphs.zh-tw: Of those 85 takes, only three actually successfully completed their run. We destroyed two pianos and 10 televisions in the process.
paragraphs.en: 在這85次的拍攝中 只有3次成功的把所有機關都啟動 拍攝過程中我們共砸了2台鋼琴 還有10台電視機

paragraphs.zh-tw: We went to Home Depot well over a hundred times. And we lost one high-heeled shoe when one of our engineers, Heather Knight, left her high-heeled shoe -- after a nice dinner, and returned back to the build -- and left it in a pile of stuff.
paragraphs.en: 我們逛了100多次的家得寶 (註:美國家庭飾品與建材的零售商) 有人還弄丟了一支高跟鞋 某天，我們的工程師海瑟奈特 在浪漫的燭光晚餐後 她回到倉庫工作 然後把高跟鞋跟一些道具放在一起

paragraphs.zh-tw: And another engineer thought, "Well, that would be a really good thing to use" and ended up using it as a really nice trigger. And it's actually in the machine.
paragraphs.en: 另一位工程師看到了，覺得"嗯，這應該可以好好利用" 最後這鞋子也真的成為一個很棒的機關 它就是這樣不見的

paragraphs.zh-tw: So what did we learn from all of this? Well, having completed this, we have the opportunity to step back and reflect on some of the things. And we learned that small stuff stinks.
paragraphs.en: 講半天，我們到底學到什麼? 基本上，是在完成之後 我們才有機會回頭來審視 到底得到了些什麼 我們深刻體會到"魔鬼就在細節裡"

paragraphs.zh-tw: Little balls in wooden tracks are really susceptible to humidity and temperature and a little bit of dust, and they fall out of the tracks, the exact angles makes it hard to get right. And yet, a bowling ball will always follow the same path.
paragraphs.en: 我們在木版上刻溝槽 想讓小鋼珠能順著溝槽前進，但順利與否 要取決於濕度、溫度、有沒有灰塵 沒顧好這些細節就很難控制小珠子 軌道角度一點點不對就會影響球的走向 如果用的是保齡球就不會有這樣的困擾

paragraphs.zh-tw: It doesn't matter what temperature it is, doesn't matter what's in its way; it will pretty much get where it needs to go. But as much as the small stuff stinks, we needed somewhere to start, so that we would have somewhere to go.
paragraphs.en: 不用管啥溫度還是什麼 也不用太關心它的行經路線 因為它本身的重量體積能幫助它順利前進 越小的東西需要越多的注意力，我們需要正確的基本態度 以便我們能前往共同一致的目標

paragraphs.zh-tw: And so you have to start with it. You have to focus on it. Small stuff stinks, but, of course, it's essential, right? What else? Planning is incredibly important.
paragraphs.en: 任何人都應該了解這一點，不管做任何事都一樣 魔鬼就在細節裡 但細節是最重要的 還學到什麼?大家都知道事前規劃超級重要 (該死的平面配置圖)

paragraphs.zh-tw: You know, we spent a lot of time ideating and even building some of these things. It's been said that, "No battle plan survives contact with the enemy." I think our enemy was physics -- and she's a cruel mistress.
paragraphs.en: 你們要瞭解，概念發想到機械建構 (施壓點) (某東西踢倒書) 花了我們不少時間 古人有云：任何作戰計畫， 跟敵人交鋒後都是廢紙一張 我們的敵人就是物理學 (最後的書打到槓桿) (假手啟動iPod) 它是個難搞的傢伙

paragraphs.zh-tw: Often, we had to pull things out as a result because of timing or aesthetics or whatever. And so while planning is important, so is flexibility.
paragraphs.en: 常常我們需要改變計畫 (啟動低音喇叭 震波啟動坡道上的球) 因為時間有限、美感訴求、還有種種因素 事前規劃很重要，也要有彈性地做變化

paragraphs.zh-tw: These are all things that ended up not making it into the final machine. So also, put reliable stuff last, the stuff that's going to run every time.
paragraphs.en: 要順利完成這台裝置 必須要取捨一些東西 我們會把失敗率較低的機關設在後面 這些機關總是能順利啟動，不需費心

paragraphs.zh-tw: Again, small to large is relevant here. The little Lego car in the beginning of the video references the big, real car near the end of the video.
paragraphs.en: 小道具跟大道具的機關設置也是一樣 出現在片頭的樂高玩具車 和片尾的實體車 互相呼應

paragraphs.zh-tw: The big, real car works every time; there's no problem about it. The little one had a tendency to try to run off the track and that's a problem.
paragraphs.en: 這台實體車做的機關每次操作總是很穩定 樂高小車卻很容易偏離軌道 這是個問題

paragraphs.zh-tw: But you don't want to have to reset the whole machine because the Lego car at the end doesn't work, right. So you put that up front so that, if it fails, at least you know you don't have to reset the whole thing.
paragraphs.en: 你不想要因為這台玩具車在最後沒有啟動 導致整個過程重來 所以我們決定把小車機關放在前面 就算這機關沒啟動 你至少知道不需要重新設置全部機關

paragraphs.zh-tw: Life can be messy. There were incredibly difficult moments in the building of this thing.
paragraphs.en: 人生可能是 混亂的 為了打造這台裝置我們經歷了許多難以想像的艱苦時刻

paragraphs.zh-tw: Months were spent in this tiny, cold warehouse. And the wonderful elation that we had when we finally completed it.
paragraphs.en: 好幾個月耗在又小又冷的倉庫裡 而到了最後 我們享受嚐到了甜美的成果

paragraphs.zh-tw: So it's important to remember that whether it's good or it's bad, "This Too Shall Pass." Thank you very much. And now to introduce their music video, we have OK Go.
paragraphs.en: 請記住，不管人生中發生了怎樣的喜事，或是壞事 "這一切終將過去" 感謝各位 現在跟各位介紹 由OK Go帶來的 這支音樂錄影帶

paragraphs.zh-tw: OK Go: An introduction. Hello TEDxUSC. We are OK Go.
paragraphs.en: 輪到我們自我介紹了。哈囉，TEDxUSC論壇的各位 我們是OK Go

paragraphs.zh-tw: What are we doing? Oh, just hanging out with our Grammy. What what! It think we can do better than this. Hello TEDxUSC. We are OK Go. Have you read the "Natural Curiosity Cabinet?" I mean, "Curiosity" -- excuse me.
paragraphs.en: 現在要幹麼?跟大家分享葛來美得獎心得吧。啥??? 這次要正經一點啦。哈囉，TEDxUSC論壇的各位 我們是OK Go.你們有看過自藍奇珍這本書嗎? 對不起，是自"然"奇珍 (18世紀植物手繪本)

paragraphs.zh-tw: Let me start again. We need some more ridiculous things besides "The Cabinet of Natural Curiosities." Tim's sundial hat.
paragraphs.en: 重來一次 我們從《自然奇珍》這本書看到很多超酷炫的東西 提姆的日晷帽

paragraphs.zh-tw: Have you seen the new work they've done to the Waltz Towers? Sorry, start again. (Barking) Dogs.
paragraphs.en: 你們有沒有看過Waltz Towers的最新作品? 抱歉，再重來一次 (汪汪) ....有狗來亂

paragraphs.zh-tw: Hello, TEDxUSC. We are OK Go, and this our new video, "This Too Shall Pass." [unclear] Kay, we can still do one better I think, yeah. That one's pretty good. It's getting better.
paragraphs.en: 哈囉，TEDxUSC論壇的各位，我們是OK Go 很高興跟各位分享我們的新MV"一切終將過去" [不清晰] 凱，我覺得我們可以再錄一次 這次真的不錯，有進步了

title: Adam Sadowsky Engineers A Viral Music Video
